Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: We need to answer tasks: identify long cases, analyze attributes, propose explanations and suggestions.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Provide calculations of durations per case, highlight those > typical.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: A thorough analysis starts by identifying potential correlations. The attributes Complexity, Region, and Resource are hypothesized to be potential root causes for long case durations.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: By observing the data, a general rule is inferred: cases with High or Medium complexity consistently take longer than those with Low complexity. This is observed across all long cases (2002, 2003, 2005).

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: A specific process pattern is recognized: the activity Request Additional Documents only occurs in the long-running cases. Furthermore, the number of repetitions of this activity appears to increase with case duration.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: The initial hypothesis about complexity is validated and refined. The reason high-complexity claims take longer is because they involve one or more Request Additional Documents rework loops, which is the direct mechanism causing the delay.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Alternative hypotheses are eliminated. Since both short and long cases are processed in Region A and B, and by various managers and adjusters, it is deduced that Region and specific Resources are not the primary root causes of the delay.
